ncsa.hdf.view

Class DefaultTableView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JInternalFrame
            • ncsa.hdf.view.DefaultTableView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, DataView, TableView

    public class DefaultTableView
extends javax.swing.JInternalFrame
implements TableView, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    TableView displays an HDF dataset as a two-dimensional table.
    Version:
    2.4 9/6/2007
    Author:
    Peter X. Cao
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultTableView

        public DefaultTableView(ViewManager theView)
        Constructs an TableView.

        Parameters:
        theView - the main HDFView.

      • DefaultTableView

        public DefaultTableView(ViewManager theView,
                java.util.HashMap map)
        Constructs an TableView.

        Parameters:
        theView - the main HDFView.
        map - the properties on how to show the data. The map is used to allow applications to pass properties on how to display the data, such as, transposing data, showing data as character, applying bitmask, and etc. Predefined keys are listed at ViewProperties.DATA_VIEW_KEY.
